div.ab: 1. Weekly news-letter to English newspapers; either entire, solely, or divided into 2 or 3 parts, separate subscription to each of which is possible and on the part of people not editors of newspapers. 2. Weekly commercial letter for the Portuguese market from foreign markets & from the local one also. (This can widen & develop into a weekly paper). 3. Weekly Portuguese trade letter for foreign tradesmen (in English). [This can be the third part of 1] 4. Translation of Catalogues and prospectuses into Portuguese, [or Extend to translation of from Port[uguese] into foreign languages] courses, & offer services e. g. Payment for their installation. 5. Obtaining of foreign advertisements for Port[uguese] papers – look up (1) constant and universal foreign advertisers, (2) houses requiring foreign agents, (3) others. 6. Editon of Six-Language Commercial & Technical Dictionary, & subscriptions (and advertisements for it). 7. “All about Portugal” 8. Propaganda Leaflets on Portugal. 9. Great Anthology 10. Amateur Mechanic (or, complete, Enclyclopedia Practica) – in “tomos” in Portuguese. 11. In Parts – † – Short Hist[ory] of Freethought. 12. Some Encyclopedia (v. Britannica, †, Foreign’s, Cambridge, etc.) 13. Translation of Shakespeare – tomos quizenais (or volumes) 5. Grande Anthologia, in Portuguese. (não será posta à venda) – Begin Tempest. (Buy “Short History Library”) (issue begins in 1921) (Agents in all Brazil) (one per state) (or in here for all Brazil) (we † how propaganda is made) _______________________________________________ Anthologia: – Publicação portugueza incluindo traducções de obras completas Athena – de varios tamanhos, e em exacta conformação com o original – Publica-se em tomos mensaes, podendo levar annuncios em folhas de resguardo; cousa como o “Strand Magazine”. Numeros (tomos), de 160 (16x10) paginas, em bom papel. Paginas supplementares de annuncios: De 16x2 (32) a 16x5 (80). Generos de annuncios: livros editores de toda a parte, principiando pelos nacionaes; casa de artigos de luxo; etc. (menos o annuncio commercial) 1º numero: – “A Tormenta” de Shakespeare. Poemas de José Anastacio da Cunha. Alguns poemas de Edgar Poe. 2º Numero: – Poemas dos velhos Cancioneiros. “Hamlet, Principe da Dinamarca”
